title: Horowitz Index for Lung Function (P/F Ratio)
description: Assesses lung function, particularly in intubated patients, by calculating the ratio of arterial oxygen partial pressure to fraction of inspired oxygen. Also known as the P/F ratio or Carrico index.

parameters.name: pao2
parameters.description: Partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood from ABG

parameters.name: fio2
parameters.description: Fraction of inspired oxygen (as decimal, not percentage). Room air = 0.21, 100% oxygen = 1.0

result.name: pf_ratio
result.description: P/F ratio (Horowitz Index) indicating lung function status

ranges.interpretation: Normal lung function. P/F ratio above 400 mmHg indicates adequate oxygenation.
Mild oxygenation impairment. Not consistent with ARDS but indicates some degree of lung dysfunction.
Mild ARDS according to Berlin criteria. Associated with approximately 27% mortality. Consider lung protective ventilation strategies.
Moderate ARDS according to Berlin criteria. Associated with approximately 32% mortality. Implement lung protective ventilation and consider prone positioning.
Severe ARDS according to Berlin criteria. Associated with approximately 45% mortality. Consider advanced therapies including prone positioning, neuromuscular blockade, and ECMO evaluation.

references: Horovitz JH, Carrico CJ, Shires GT. Pulmonary response to major injury. Arch Surg. 1974 Mar;108(3):349-55.

Bernard GR, Artigas A, Brigham KL, Carlet J, Falke K, Hudson L, et al. The American-European Consensus Conference on ARDS. Definitions, mechanisms, relevant outcomes, and clinical trial coordination. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 1994 Mar;149(3 Pt 1):818-24.
ARDS Definition Task Force, Ranieri VM, Rubenfeld GD, Thompson BT, Ferguson ND, Caldwell E, et al. Acute respiratory distress syndrome: the Berlin Definition. JAMA. 2012 Jun 20;307(23):2526-33.
notes: Requires arterial blood gas (ABG) for accurate PaO2 measurement
FiO2 must be expressed as a fraction (e.g., 0.5 for 50%), not as a percentage
Normal P/F ratio at sea level is typically 400-500 mmHg
Cannot distinguish between hypoventilation and V/Q mismatch
Used in several severity scoring systems including SOFA, SAPS II, and SAPS III
The Berlin Definition requires PEEP ≥5 cm H2O for ARDS diagnosis
Consider altitude adjustment at elevations >1000 meters
Also known as the Horowitz Index or Carrico Index
